name: lncpipe-lncrna-discovery
title: lncPipe - Long Non-coding RNA Discovery & Analysis
description: Comprehensive pipeline for long non-coding RNA (lncRNA) discovery, annotation, and differential expression analysis from RNA-seq data. Identifies novel lncRNAs and characterizes their expression patterns. Samplesheet format: `Human,mouse,or`
content:
lncPipe - Long Non-coding RNA Discovery

lncPipe is a comprehensive bioinformatics pipeline for identifying, annotating, and analyzing long non-coding RNAs (lncRNAs) from RNA-seq datasets. It enables genome-wide discovery of novel lncRNAs and differential expression analysis between conditions.

What are Long Non-coding RNAs (lncRNAs)?

The Biology:

  • Definition: RNA transcripts longer than 200 nucleotides that do not encode proteins
  • Abundance: Tens of thousands of lncRNAs in mammalian genomes
  • Location: Intergenic (lincRNAs), intronic, antisense, or overlapping protein-coding genes
  • Conservation: Generally less conserved than mRNAs but functionally important
  • Expression: Often tissue-specific and developmentally regulated

Why Study lncRNAs?

  • Gene Regulation: Control transcription, splicing, and translation
  • Chromatin Remodeling: Guide chromatin-modifying complexes to specific loci
  • Nuclear Organization: Form nuclear bodies and compartments
  • Disease Relevance: Implicated in cancer, neurological disorders, cardiovascular disease
  • Therapeutic Targets: Emerging as potential drug targets and biomarkers
  • Cellular Identity: Define cell types and developmental states
  • X-inactivation: XIST lncRNA silences entire chromosome

lncRNA Functions

FunctionMechanismExamples
Transcriptional RegulationRecruit TFs or chromatin modifiersHOTAIR, MALAT1
Splicing RegulationModulate splicing machineryMALAT1
Translation ControlCompete with mRNAs for ribosomeslincRNA-p21
Protein ScaffoldsBring proteins togetherNEAT1, HOTAIR
miRNA SpongesSequester miRNAs (ceRNAs)H19, LINC00161
Enhancer RNAsActivate nearby geneseRNAs

lncPipe Pipeline Workflow

  1. Quality Control: FastQC assesses raw read quality
  2. Adapter Trimming: Remove sequencing adapters and low-quality bases
  3. Alignment: Map reads to reference genome (STAR/HISAT2)
  4. Transcript Assembly: De novo assembly of transcripts (StringTie/Cufflinks)
  5. lncRNA Identification: Distinguish lncRNAs from protein-coding transcripts
    • ORF prediction and filtering
    • Coding potential assessment (CPAT, CPC2, PLEK)
    • Domain homology filtering (Pfam)
    • Known annotation comparison
  6. Annotation: Classify lncRNAs (intergenic, antisense, intronic)
  7. Quantification: Expression levels across samples
  8. Differential Expression: Identify condition-specific lncRNAs (DESeq2/edgeR)
  9. Quality Metrics: Comprehensive QC reports (MultiQC)

lncRNA Identification Strategy

Coding Potential Assessment:

  • CPAT: Alignment-free coding potential calculator
  • CPC2: Coding Potential Calculator based on sequence features
  • PLEK: Predictor of long non-coding RNAs and mRNAs based on k-mer scheme
  • Consensus Approach: Combine multiple tools for robust classification

Filtering Criteria:

  • Length: >200 nucleotides (by definition)
  • ORF Length: Short open reading frames (<100 amino acids)
  • Expression: Minimum expression threshold (FPKM/TPM)
  • Exon Count: Typically multi-exonic (though some lncRNAs are single-exon)
  • Coding Potential Score: Below threshold for all prediction tools
  • Pfam Domain: No known protein domains

lncRNA Classification

  • Long Intergenic Non-coding RNAs (lincRNAs): Between protein-coding genes
  • Antisense lncRNAs: Transcribed from opposite strand of protein-coding gene
  • Intronic lncRNAs: Within introns of protein-coding genes
  • Sense Overlapping: Overlap protein-coding genes on same strand
  • Bidirectional Promoter lncRNAs: Share promoter with protein-coding gene
  • Enhancer RNAs (eRNAs): Transcribed from enhancer regions

Scientific Applications

  • Cancer Research: Oncogenic and tumor-suppressor lncRNAs
    • MALAT1: Metastasis-associated lung adenocarcinoma transcript
    • HOTAIR: HOX transcript antisense RNA, promotes metastasis
    • H19: Imprinted lncRNA with tumor-specific roles
  • Development: Lineage specification and differentiation
    • XIST: X-chromosome inactivation
    • NEAT1: Nuclear paraspeckle formation
    • SOX2-OT: Neural stem cell maintenance
  • Immunology: Immune cell differentiation and response
    • lincRNA-Cox2: Inflammatory gene regulation
    • NRON: Nuclear receptor repressor
  • Neuroscience: Brain development and neurological disorders
    • BDNF-AS: Brain-derived neurotrophic factor antisense
    • MIAT: Myocardial infarction associated transcript (neuronal function)
  • Cardiovascular Disease: Cardiac development and disease
    • ANRIL: Antisense non-coding RNA in INK4 locus
    • MHRT: Myosin heavy-chain-associated RNA transcript

Pipeline Features

  • Multi-Tool Integration: Combines multiple coding potential calculators for robust classification
  • De Novo Discovery: Identifies novel lncRNAs not in existing annotations
  • Differential Expression: Statistical analysis of condition-specific expression
  • Comprehensive Annotation: Classifies lncRNA biotypes and genomic context
  • Quality Control: Extensive QC metrics throughout pipeline
  • Reproducible: Containerized tools ensure consistent results
  • Scalable: Handles large RNA-seq datasets efficiently

Input Requirements

CSV samplesheet with RNA-seq data:

  • sample: Sample identifier
  • fastq_1: Path to R1 FASTQ file (or single-end reads)
  • fastq_2: Path to R2 FASTQ file (for paired-end)
  • strandedness: Library strandedness (unstranded/forward/reverse)

Recommended RNA-seq Data:

  • Depth: >50M reads per sample for comprehensive discovery
  • Read Length: ≥75bp paired-end preferred
  • Library Type: Total RNA or polyA+ RNA (ribo-depleted better for lncRNA detection)
  • Replicates: ≥3 biological replicates per condition
  • Strand-specific: Recommended for accurate antisense lncRNA detection

Reference Requirements

  • Genome FASTA: Reference genome sequence
  • Gene Annotation: GTF/GFF file with known genes (optional but recommended)
  • Supported Genomes: Human, mouse, or any species with reference genome

Key Outputs

  • Novel lncRNA Catalog: GTF/BED files with newly identified lncRNAs
  • Coding Potential Scores: Classification scores from multiple tools
  • Expression Matrix: Quantification across all samples (FPKM/TPM)
  • Differential Expression Results: Condition-specific lncRNAs with statistics
  • lncRNA Annotations: Biotype classification, genomic context
  • Sequence Files: FASTA files of lncRNA sequences
  • Quality Reports: MultiQC comprehensive QC report
  • Alignment Statistics: Mapping rates, duplication metrics

QC Metrics

  • Read Quality: Per-base quality scores, adapter content
  • Mapping Statistics: Alignment rate, uniquely mapped reads
  • Gene Body Coverage: 5' to 3' coverage bias
  • Duplication Rate: PCR duplication levels
  • Library Complexity: Saturation analysis
  • Coding Potential Distribution: Score distributions across tools
  • lncRNA Characteristics: Length distribution, exon count, expression levels

Downstream Analysis Suggestions

  • Functional Enrichment: Identify enriched pathways near lncRNAs
  • Co-expression Networks: Find lncRNA-mRNA regulatory relationships
  • WGCNA: Weighted gene co-expression network analysis
  • Motif Analysis: Identify sequence motifs in lncRNAs
  • Structure Prediction: Secondary structure prediction (RNAfold)
  • Conservation Analysis: PhyloP/PhastCons scores
  • GWAS Integration: Link lncRNAs to disease-associated loci
  • ceRNA Analysis: Competing endogenous RNA network reconstruction

Comparison: lncRNAs vs mRNAs

FeaturelncRNAsmRNAs
Length>200 ntVariable
Coding PotentialNon-codingProtein-coding
ExpressionLower, tissue-specificHigher, broad
ConservationLower sequence conservationHigh conservation
Exon CountFewer exons (typically 2-3)More exons
SplicingYes, but less efficientYes, highly efficient
LocalizationNuclear or cytoplasmicCytoplasmic (translated)
PolyA TailMost are polyadenylatedPolyadenylated

Disease-Associated lncRNAs

  • MALAT1: Lung cancer metastasis
  • HOTAIR: Breast cancer progression
  • ANRIL: Cardiovascular disease, diabetes
  • H19: Cancer, Beckwith-Wiedemann syndrome
  • XIST: X-linked disorders
  • MEG3: Tumor suppressor, multiple cancers
  • UCA1: Bladder cancer
  • TUG1: Retinal development, cancer

Perfect for: lncRNA discovery • Transcriptome annotation • Cancer research • Developmental biology • Biomarker identification • Non-coding RNA catalogs
